---
title: "nesting data frames"
output: html_notebook
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r}
starwars |>
  group_by(gender) |>
  nest()
```

```{r}
starwars |>
  nest(-gender)
```

```{r}
starwars |>
  nest(-gender) |>
  mutate(my_plot = map(data, ~ make_me_a_plot(.x)))
```

```{r}
starwars |>
  nest(-gender) |>
  mutate(my_plot = map(data, ~ make_me_a_plot(.x))) # |> # make_me_a_plot function is in lesson 3
  # pull(my_plot)

starwars |> 
  nest(-gender) |> 
  group_by(gender) |>
  mutate(my_plot = map(data, ~ make_me_a_plot(.x))) |> 
  mutate(my_plot_with_title = map(my_plot, ~ .x + ggtitle(gender))) |>
  pull(my_plot_with_title)
```

```{r}
starwars |>
  nest(-sex) |>
  mutate(my_plot = map(data, plot_mh)) |>
  mutate(my_plot = map(my_plot, ~ .x + labs(title = sex))) |> 
  mutate(my_model = map(data, ~ lm(mass ~ height, data = .x))) |>
  mutate(my_tidy_model = map(my_model, ~ .x |> broom::tidy())) |> 
  unnest(my_tidy_model) # |>
```
